summary: The Health Coverage for Inclusive and Valued Families Act of 2025 (H.R. 3480) amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to include fertility treatment and care as an essential health benefit. It defines fertility treatment and care broadly, covering procedures like IVF, and specifies requirements related to coverage parity with other medical benefits. The bill also prohibits denial of care based on a lack of infertility diagnosis and mandates analysis and reporting on the application of utilization management tools for fertility treatments.
